Expectation1: Perform assigned physical tasks and material handling efficiently.
Situation1: A carpenter is waiting for you to bring them the next load of lumber so they can continue their work without interruption.
Expectation2: Attend weekly church services to worship and participate in community activities
Situation2: They are expected to attend every service and take part in church community activities consistently
Story: I wiped the sweat from my brow as I hefted another plank of lumber onto my shoulder. The foreman’s voice echoed across the site, reminding me that the carpenter was waiting for the next load. I knew if I didn’t keep up, the whole crew would fall behind, and I’d be letting everyone down. My muscles ached, but I pushed on, determined to do my part. Yet, as I glanced at my phone, I saw the reminder for tonight’s church service. Pastor had asked me to help set up chairs and greet newcomers—something I’d promised to do every week. My church family counted on me, and I felt a deep responsibility to honor my commitment to God and the community. The clock ticked closer to the service time, but the pile of lumber was far from gone. My heart pounded with anxiety, torn between the demands of my job and my faith. I stood there, caught in the middle, feeling the weight of both worlds pressing down on me, unsure which path to take.
